result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Deangelo Cumby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served.
The first 6 months: Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.
The last 6 months: Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment. The defendant is eligible for the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation.  If revoked, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.

Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens.  No positive results.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Deangelo Cumby

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 8/20/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant Kenneth Deangelo Cumby in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served.
The first 6 months: Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.
The last 6 months: Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment. The defendant is eligible for the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.  

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment and/or school.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Community service of 100 hours.  

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation.  If revoked, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.

Defendant Kenneth Deangelo Cumby in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   Restitution will be determined at sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenneth Deangelo Cumby in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in trial.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Projected guilty plea hearing.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Deangelo Cumby in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-16-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenneth Deangelo Cumby in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Attorney Morales
informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for 05-19-2015 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kenneth Deangelo Cumby in court. Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales  not in court.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for James C. Griffin who appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requesting an adjournment due to congestion of her calendar. Defendant was given an orange slip, by the Deputy, with the next court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Kenneth Deangelo Cumby in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Deangelo Cumby in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for James C. Griffin for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 02/23/2015.

Defendant Kenneth Deangelo Cumby in court with Michelle Cahoon, student intern under the supervision of attorney Christian Eichenlaub for Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Ron Dague for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM003979  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01-28-2015
Any remaining cash bail on deposit shall be returned to the person who posted it.  The court ordered no driving without a valid drivers license.

Defendant Kenneth Deangelo Cumby in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/30/15 @ 1:30pm
